properties.name: morphology
properties.description: The third edition of the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, published in 2000 used principally in tumor and cancer registries for coding the site (topography) and the histology (morphology) of neoplasms. The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs. In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains. A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

properties.name: lung_localization
properties.description: Pulmonary tuberculosis (PTB) and extrapulmonary TB (EPTB): PTB and EPTB diagnosed at the same time. A patient with both pulmonary and extrapulmonary TB should be classified as a case of PTB. Extrapulmonary tuberculosis (EPTB) refers to any bacteriologically confirmed or clinically diagnosed case of TB involving organs other than the lungs, e.g. pleura, lymph nodes, abdomen, genitourinary tract, skin, joints and bones, meninges. Pulmonary tuberculosis (PTB) refers to any bacteriologically confirmed or clinically diagnosed case of TB involving the lung parenchyma or the tracheobronchial tree. Miliary TB is classified as PTB because there are lesions in the lungs. Tuberculous intra-thoracic lymphadenopathy (mediastinal and/or hilar) or tuberculous pleural effusion, without radiographic abnormalities in the lungs, constitutes a case of extrapulmonary TB.

The accepted values for tumor_stage depend on the tumor site, type, and accepted staging system. These items should accompany the tumor_stage value as associated metadata.

nodes.name: sample
nodes.description: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

properties.name: sample_type_id
properties.description: The accompanying sample type id for the sample type.

properties.name: ncbi_biosample
properties.description: Record identifier assigned by NCBI for entry in the BioSample database.

properties.name: biospecimen_anatomic_site
properties.description: Text term that represents the name of the primary disease site of the submitted tumor sample.

properties.name: oct_embedded
properties.description: Indicator of whether or not the sample was embedded in Optimal Cutting Temperature (OCT) compound.

properties.name: intermediate_dimension
properties.description: Intermediate dimension of the sample, in millimeters.

properties.name: hours_to_collection
properties.description: Time interval from the date of biospecimen collection to the date of initial pathologic diagnosis, represented as a calculated number of days.

properties.name: sample_volume
properties.description: The volume of the sample in mL.

properties.name: cell_line
properties.description: A cell culture developed from a single cell and therefore consisting of cells with a uniform genetic makeup.

properties.name: is_ffpe
properties.description: Indicator to signify whether or not the tissue sample was fixed in formalin and embedded in paraffin (FFPE).

properties.name: collection_date
properties.description: Date range in which samples were collected.

properties.name: sample_type
properties.description: Characterization of the sample as either clinical or contrived.

properties.name: passage
properties.description: A record of the number of times the culture has been subcultured.

properties.name: time_between_excision_and_freezing
properties.description: Numeric representation of the elapsed time between the excision and freezing of the sample, measured in minutes.

properties.name: ncbi_bioproject
properties.description: Record identifier assigned by NCBI for entry in the BioProject database.

properties.name: diagnosis_pathologically_confirmed
properties.description: The histologic description of tissue or cells confirmed by a pathology review of frozen or formalin fixed slide(s) completed after the diagnostic pathology review of the tumor sample used to extract analyte(s).

properties.name: current_weight
properties.description: Numeric value that represents the current weight of the sample, measured  in milligrams.

properties.name: composition
properties.description: Text term that represents the cellular composition of the sample.

properties.name: lysis_buffer
properties.description: A buffer solution used for the purpose of breaking open cells for use in molecular biology experiments that analyze the compounds of the cells.

properties.name: time_between_clamping_and_freezing
properties.description: Numeric representation of the elapsed time between the surgical clamping of blood supply and freezing of the sample, measured in minutes.

properties.name: shortest_dimension
properties.description: Numeric value that represents the shortest dimension of the sample, measured in millimeters.

properties.name: method_of_sample_procurement
properties.description: The method used to procure the sample used to extract analyte(s).

properties.name: tissue_type
properties.description: Text term that represents a description of the kind of tissue collected with respect to disease status or proximity to tumor tissue.

properties.name: days_to_sample_procurement
properties.description: The number of days from the date the patient was diagnosed to the date of the procedure that produced the sample.

properties.name: freezing_method
properties.description: Text term that represents the method used for freezing the sample.

properties.name: cell_number
properties.description: Number of cells cultured in one container.

properties.name: preservation_method
properties.description: Text term that represents the method used to preserve the sample.

properties.name: days_to_collection
properties.description: Time interval from the date of biospecimen collection to the date of initial pathologic diagnosis, represented as a calculated number of days.

properties.name: cell_culture_vessel
properties.description: Flasks, Petri dishes, roller bottles, or multiwell plates to grow cells.

properties.name: initial_weight
properties.description: Numeric value that represents the initial weight of the sample, measured in milligrams.

properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'subject' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'sample' table.

properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'follow_up' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'sample' table.

nodes.name: aliquot
nodes.description: Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight.

properties.description: The volume in microliters (ml) of the aliquot(s) derived from the analyte(s) shipped for sequencing and characterization.

properties.name: analyte_type
properties.description: Text term that represents the kind of molecular specimen analyte.

properties.name: concentration
properties.description: Numeric value that represents the concentration of an analyte or aliquot extracted from the sample or sample portion, measured in milligrams per milliliter.

properties.name: analyte_type_id
properties.description: A single letter code used to identify a type of molecular analyte.

properties.name: aliquot_quantity
properties.description: The quantity in micrograms (ug) of the aliquot(s) derived from the analyte(s) shipped for sequencing and characterization.

properties.name: aliquot_description
properties.description: Free text to describe the aliquot.

properties.name: amount
properties.description: Weight in grams or volume in mL.

properties.name: source_center
properties.description: Name of the center that provided the item.

nodes.name: virus_infection
nodes.description: The collection of all data related to virus infection in the context of a specific experiment.

properties.name: virus_subtype
properties.description: Viruses are divided into subtypes on the basis of two proteins on the surface of the virus: hemagglutinin (HA) and neuraminidase (NA).

properties.name: mutation_status
properties.description: Is there mutation within the genome of the virus.

properties.name: virus_volume
properties.description: The virus volume in microliters (ml) subject to infection.

properties.name: strain
properties.description: A lower-level taxonomic rank used in microbiology or virology, plants and rodents, usually at the intraspecific level (within a species).

properties.name: moi
properties.description: Multiplicity of infection is the average number of virus particles infecting each cell.

properties.name: infection_buffer
properties.description: The buffer solution to dissolve virus for infection.

properties.name: virus_titer_in_stock
properties.description: A numerical expression of the quantity of virus in a given volume in stock. It is expressed in plaque forming units (pfu) per mL.

properties.name: post_infection_TPCK
properties.description: The concentration of TPCK in growth medium for cell culture post virus infection.

properties.name: post_infection_BSA_percentage
properties.description: The percentage of BSA in growth medium for cell culture post virus infection.

properties.name: post_infection_medium
properties.description: The growth medium for cell culture post virus infection.

properties.name: virus_type
properties.description: Virus type.

properties.name: mutation
properties.description: A brief description of the mutation.

properties.name: infection_dose
properties.description: The amount of virus measured in plaque forming units (pfu) administered to each subject.

properties.name: mcp1
properties.description: The determination of the amount of monocyte chemotactic protein 1 present in a sample.  Human CCL2 wild-type allele is located within 17q11.2-q12 and is approximately 2 kb in length. This allele, which encodes C-C motif chemokine 2 protein, is involved in the mediation of immune cell chemotaxis during tissue injury.

properties.name: hematocrit
properties.description: Hematocrit (%)

properties.name: virus_titer_rep3
properties.description: A numerical expression of the quantity of virus in a given volume in third test. It is expressed in plaque forming unites (pfu) per mL.

properties.description: Triglycerides (mg/dL)

properties.name: leu3p
properties.description: % CD4 positive cells (helpers)

properties.name: wbc
properties.description: Count of white blood cells

properties.name: il10
properties.description: The determination of the amount of interleukin 10 present in a sample.  Interleukin-10 (178 aa, ~21 kDa) is encoded by the human IL10 gene. This protein plays a role in the negative regulation of cytokine expression.

properties.name: il12
properties.description: The determination of the amount of interleukin 12 present in a sample.  Exhibiting a broad range of biological activities on T and natural killer cells, Interleukin-12 is a disulfide-bonded heterodimeric cytokine composed of a 35-kD IL12A subunit (IL-6 Superfamily) and a 40-kDa IL12B subunit (Type I Cytokine Receptor 3 Family). IL12 stimulates T-cell-independent production of IFN-gamma by PBMCs, enhances NK cell lytic activity, acts as a growth factor for T- and NK-cells, and is important for Th1 and Th2 cell differentiation. Lymphocyte responses to IL12 require NOS2A and are mediated by STAT4 activator of transcription. (NCI).

properties.name: ldlcholc
properties.description: LDL Cholesterol calculated from other measurements (mg/dL)

properties.name: gp130
properties.description: Interleukin-6 receptor subunit beta (918 aa, ~104 kDa) is encoded by the human IL6ST gene. This protein is involved in cytokine receptor-mediated signal transduction.

properties.name: il17
properties.description: The determination of the amount of interleukin 17 present in a sample.  Interleukin-17A (155 aa, ~18 kDa) is encoded by the human IL17A gene. This protein is involved in the positive regulation of cytokine production.

properties.name: il6
properties.description: The determination of the amount of soluble interleukin 6 Receptor present in a sample.  Interleukin-6 (212 aa, ~24 kDa) is encoded by the human IL6 gene. This protein is involved in signaling affecting a wide variety of cell types including monocytes, lymphocytes, hepatocytes and nerve cells.

properties.name: viral_load_kit
properties.description: Viral Load Kit used

properties.name: il4
properties.description: The determination of the amount of interleukin 4 present in a sample.  Interleukin-4 (153 aa, ~17 kDa) is encoded by the human IL4 gene. This protein is involved in the regulation of the expression of class II MHC molecules, Fc receptors and cell surface-bound immunoglobulins.

properties.name: version
properties.description: Version number of data

properties.name: il2
properties.description: The determination of the amount of interleukin 2 present in a sample.  Interleukin-2 (153 aa, ~18 kDa) is encoded by the human IL2 gene. This protein is involved in T-cell proliferation, leukocyte stimulation and immune responses.

properties.name: tnfa
properties.description: The determination of the amount of TNF-alpha production inhibitory activity present in a sample.  Tumor necrosis factor (233 aa, ~26 kDa) is encoded by the human TNF gene. This protein is involved in the induction of cytokine expression, the stimulation of cell proliferation and the positive regulation of cell differentiation.

properties.name: leu3n
properties.description: # of CD4 positive cells (helpers, cells per mm^3)

properties.name: il8
properties.description: The determination of the amount of interleukin 8 present in a sample.  Interleukin-8 (99 aa, ~11 kDa) is encoded by the human CXCL8 gene. This protein is involved in chemotaxis and neutrophil activation.

properties.name: gmcsf
properties.description: The determination of the amount of granulocyte macrophage colony stimulating factor present in a sample.  Granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor (144 aa, ~16 kDa) is encoded by the human CSF2 gene. This protein plays a role in the positive regulation of the growth and differentiation of cells in the granulocyte, macrophage, eosinophil and erythrocyte lineages.

properties.name: ifng
